intro: Galium aparine var. spurium, commonly known as bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems that are covered with fine, hooked hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often have a slightly serrated margin. Galium aparine var. spurium is typically found in moist, disturbed soils and is often used in traditional herbal medicine.
